attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
the green belt was set up to give the poor access to greenery, but it just stops building and prices them out of a home. the green belt near me is brown, too expensive to grow on. gardens by houses would be far greener. like bank holidays it's meant to benefit the poor but helps the rich.

Let people build there as long as the land value increasses benefit housing for the poor - probably better if developers give the money to housing associations. It's the green belt that keeps house prices unaffordable to the poor.
